image.altText: Johnathon Bush leans forward with his arms crossed over in front of one of his artworks.

props.synopsis: Johnathon "World Peace" Bush is the latest in a long line of remote Indigenous artists to have gained global recognition by telling stories to, and finding a value with, international audiences and buyers.

title.children: From a tiny community, Johnathan is a voice to the rest of the world

image.altText: Man woman and 23-year-old daughter sit outside on the grass. their small brown dog at their feet

props.synopsis: Anna Coutts-Trotter was a teenager doing well at school, living at home with supportive parents Tanya Plibersek and Michael Coutts-Trotter. But she was being abused by her then-boyfriend.

title.children: 'I wanted to kill him for hurting my child': Inside Tanya Plibersek's family's fight for justice after daughter Anna was abused

image.altText: A man in a suit and bow tie and a woman in a wedding dress with her face blurred make gun signals at each other with their hands

props.synopsis: A Four Corners investigation has named a 38-year-old Sydney man suspected of being one of the major importers of methamphetamine into Australia.

title.children: The 38-year-old man suspected of being behind large shipments of meth bound for Australia

image.altText: A man standing and looking at the camera, in a room with many photos on the wall

props.synopsis: World leaders have fought this Israeli "doomsday" settlement plan in the West Bank for decades. But now it's just "two pen strokes" away, and some are worried the war in Gaza could change everything.

title.children: World leaders have fought against this Israeli plan for decades — some say it's closer than ever

image.altText: Specialist staff at the Howard Springs facility wear heavy PPE gear.

props.synopsis: A joint inquest into the deaths of three people has heard of failings and extreme pressures at the Howard Springs quarantine facility during COVID.

title.children: Three deaths at Australia's 'gold standard' quarantine centre are being probed by the NT coroner

image.altText: Senator Linda Reynolds smiles as she is interviewed outside court.

props.synopsis: Senator Linda Reynolds said she appreciated Brittany Higgins' apology to herself and Fiona Brown, but said if Ms Higgins does not accept Justice Lee's finding there was no cover-up, she will continue with her defamation trial.

title.children: Linda Reynolds welcomes Brittany Higgins's 'olive branch', but says she will continue with trial

image.altText: A woman standing in a doorway.

props.synopsis: It took nine months to identify a damaged pipe belonging to state water utility TasWater as the cause of a leak damaging Barbara Turner's Launceston home. Two years later, she can't get rid of the mould.

title.children: A room in Barbara's new build is uninhabitable. The cause was a water company failure

image.altText: Wang Yi in a suit standing next to James Marape in front of Chinese and PNG flags.

props.synopsis: China's top diplomat, Foreign Minister Wang Yi, will have departed Port Moresby's Jacksons International Airport just a day before Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese touches down for an extended visit to walk the Kokoda Track.

title.children: Papua New Guinea was 'blessed' with a visit by China just a day ago. Anthony Albanese is hot on their tail

image.altText: Anthony Albanese looks solemn as he walks in front of police officers with a lit candle.

props.synopsis: Against the backdrop of a golden-hour Bondi Beach, a solemn crowd gathered to pay respects to the six people killed in the Westfield stabbing attack and make sense of the senseless together.

title.children: In Bondi, they spoke of brighter tomorrows as the sun set. Residents say it's what they needed

image.altText: two emotional young women hug at the bondi beach vigil 210424

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people have lit a candle at Bondi Beach at a sombre sunset vigil for the six victims of last weekend's violent attack at Bondi Junction shopping centre.

title.children: Hundreds light candles for victims of Bondi stabbing attack as injured baby discharged from hospital

image.altText: A farmer wearing a blue shirt standing next to a tomato vine and holding some fruit in his hands

props.synopsis: Fruit and vegetable growers are expected to give evidence behind closed doors, out of fear of retribution, about supermarket price gouging and low farmgate prices.

title.children: Farmers seek protection from 'mafia tactics' of big supermarkets

image.altText: Dozens of birds stand in shallow water.

props.synopsis: A proposed $1.4 billion redevelopment of internationally protected wetlands in Queensland has been scrapped for now. But it's unlikely developers will stop trying to build in similar sites.

title.children: How a 1971 treaty is protecting Australian wetlands and frustrating big developers

image.altText: A drone shot of Luna Park and the Palais Theatre looking out over St Kilda beach.

props.synopsis: Why Melbourne's Port Phillip, known to many simply as "the bay", may not actually be a bay at all.

title.children: Call it Naarm, call it Port Phillip — just beware if you call it a bay

image.altText: A woman crouching looking up at a furry animal and patting it as its held by another person.

props.synopsis: More clean energy projects than ever are being assessed under federal environmental laws and it's slowing down the pace of development, according to investors.

title.children: More than 100 renewable energy projects are stuck waiting for approval under federal environment laws

image.altText: Anonymised pic of a doctor's hands at a desk holding a stethoscope

props.synopsis: Doctors warn the government's $3.5 billion investment to make visiting GPs more affordable is being pocketed by states that changed their payroll tax rules, leaving little room to lift bulk billing rates.

title.children: Federal bulk-billing push being 'killed off' by states increasing tax take on GP clinics, doctors warn

image.altText: A man wearing orange and black stands next to a trail bike.

props.synopsis: Police believe the 58-year-old, who had been missing for two days, may have died in a motorbike accident.

title.children: Missing camper Steven Clough found dead in Victoria's high country

image.altText: Composite image of Mikaele Ravalawa of the Dragons, Reece Walsh of the Broncos and Kieran Foran of the Titans in NRL games.

props.synopsis: The congested NRL ladder was shaken up time and time again, with a new leader, a new lowest and still no real premiership favourite. Here is our Round-Up from another weekend of NRL action.

title.children: NRL Round-Up: A new leader surges, a new lowest sinks and a new Lomax special

image.altText: An F1 driver standing in the garage, wearing a cap, looking on the pit lane

props.synopsis: Australian driver Daniel Ricciardo's promising weekend in China was foiled by rival Lance Stroll, when the Canadian ran into the back of him.

title.children: 'He's not even looking at me': Ricciardo fumes as Stroll crash ends his race in China

image.altText: A composite image of Mason Cox and Bobby Hill, Harley Reid, and Patrick Cripps

props.synopsis: Carlton's superstars blow GWS away, Harley Reid goes supersonic in the west and Collingwood look a lot like Collingwood again. Here are the biggest talking points from every game of round six.

title.children: AFL Round-Up: Blues' big four erupt, Harley dominates the derby and the Pies are looking ominous

image.altText: NSW Treasurer Daniel Mookhey stands in front of his desk posing for a potograph

props.synopsis: New South Wales is facing a budget shortfall that's worse than the shock experienced during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title.children: NSW facing a 'COVID-like' budget shock due to $11.9 billion GST hole

image.altText: Three wreath laid at a memorial

props.synopsis: The Australian War Memorial says the day is a time for the nation to "reflect on the many different meanings of war".

title.children: How to find an Anzac Day service near you

image.altText: A rusted pipe pushes out hot water into a small pond

props.synopsis: With the region still without a desalination plant and groundwater levels in its basins running dangerously low, South Australian industries and homes could be forced to cut water considerably.

title.children: Eyre Peninsula water sources critically low, with restrictions likely

image.altText: Elon Musk with his hands clasped together.

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's attempts to fight orders to remove graphic footage of the Sydney stabbings from X provokes fury among federal politicians, who are renewing their focus on punishing social media platforms that host misinformation and harmful content.

title.children: Musk's response to Sydney stabbing footage prompts fury, as opposition supports crackdown on social media giants

image.altText: A professional runner crosses the finish line first, with her arms outstretched in celebration

props.synopsis: Reigning Olympic champion Peres Jepchirchir of Kenya crushed the women's-only world record in winning the 44th London Marathon on Sunday.

title.children: Jepchirchir crushes women's-only world record in winning London Marathon

image.altText: A mascot of Bluey from the TV children's show with a brass band behind it.

props.synopsis: After sparking the imagination of children across the globe, Bluey has now received a special one-off award at Australia House in London.

title.children: Bluey phenomenon continues as show is recognised in London

image.altText: Susan Khoshaba and Yalda Adam among the parishioners at Christ The Good Shepherd Church wakeley

props.synopsis: People fainted and others were crying during the first service at Christ The Good Shepherd Church in Wakeley since a knife attack on Monday.

title.children: 'Some people fainted': Emotional parishioners return to Sydney church after stabbing

image.altText: A Japanese vessel sails on the Pacific Ocean.

props.synopsis: Two Japanese navy helicopters carrying eight crew members crash in the Pacific Ocean south of Tokyo during a night-time training flight after possibly colliding with each other.

title.children: Japanese navy helicopters crash in Pacific Ocean during training, leaving one dead and seven missing

image.altText: A person unfurls a large Chinese flag at a stadium, many photographers are seen in the background

props.synopsis: Revelations of positive doping tests for nearly two dozen Chinese swimmers that went unpunished has sparked an intense flurry of accusations and legal threats between the World Anti-Doping Agency and the head of the US anti-doping organisation.

title.children: Chinese swimming doping case sparks spat between global and US anti-doping agencies

image.altText: Two white women wearing white political campaign t shirts stand and smile by the side of a road

props.synopsis: Two lifelong friends join forces to campaign for a single seat in federal parliament. They want to show that politics can be done differently – but not everyone's convinced it can work.

title.children: These two women are running for federal parliament as a single candidate

image.altText: Older man wearing cap, singlet and shorts laughs while standing on country football oval

props.synopsis: The country football club that made headlines for its big losses records its first win in more than 1,000 days. It marks a special moment for the community in Wahgunyah amid the club's fight for survival.

title.children: Tears and beers as struggling footy club gets first win in 1,000 days

image.altText: pink bus on outback road

props.synopsis: A sequel of Australian cult classic The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert, is in the works with the original main cast all on board, the film's director says, 30 years after the original's release.

title.children: Priscilla, Queen of the Desert sequel 'happening' with original cast 'on board', director says

image.altText: A shark on the floor of a boat.

props.synopsis: Teenager Nathan Ness has been left shaken and with wounds to his lower leg but is otherwise "fine", his family says, after he was bitten on board a fishing boat by a five-foot great white.

title.children: Boy left with 'big gashes' after being bitten by shark on fishing boat off Adelaide

image.altText: a baby in a nappy, covered in hives

props.synopsis: One in 10 children will have a proven food allergy in their first year of life, and by school, there'll be at least one child in every classroom. Yet, there is still no approved treatment and more services are desperately needed.

title.children: Australia 'has a big problem' with food allergies, but the exact cause is unknown
